title: Introduction to MongoDB
subject: MongoDB
theory: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas. It is developed by MongoDB Inc.

examples.explanation: Data is stored in field-value pairs.

common_mistakes.mistake: Comparing MongoDB Collection to SQL Table directly
common_mistakes.correction: While similar, collections don't enforce a rigid schema like tables do.

interview_questions.question: What language is MongoDB written in?

real_world_use_cases.description: Storing varied content types (articles, videos, images) without a fixed schema.

summary: MongoDB is the most popular NoSQL database, known for its flexibility and performance.
